criterion: Mentions the possibility of a pulmonary embolism as a potential cause of shortness of breath in older adults
Provides a clear and concise explanation of the symptoms and possible causes of shortness of breath in older adults
Does not suggest sending the patient to the hospital immediately without further evaluation
Mentions the importance of assessing the patient's oxygen saturation levels and lung function tests to determine the cause of shortness of breath
Falsely advises the patient to use a humidifier to relieve shortness of breath
Asks follow-up questions to clarify the patient's symptoms and medical history
Provides a list of possible causes of shortness of breath in older adults without prioritizing the most common or serious causes
Mentions the possibility of underlying chronic conditions such as chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) or heart failure as a potential cause of shortness of breath
Does not advise the patient to seek medical attention if they experience worsening shortness of breath or other concerning symptoms
Provides a clear explanation of the role of the home health nurse in assessing and managing shortness of breath in older adults
